title: Emma Haruka Iwao
summary: Emma Haruka Iwao is a Japanese computer scientist and cloud developer advocate at Google.[3][4] In 2019 Haruka Iwao calculated the then world record for most accurate value of pi (Ï€); which included 31.4 trillion digits, exceeding the previous record of 22 trillion.[5][6][7][8][9] This record was surpassed in 2020 by Timothy Mullican who calculated 50 trillion digits,[10][11] but she reclaimed the record in 2022 with 100 trillion digits.[12] She identifies as queer.[13]
